meanings.definition: A wrongful act or an infringement of a right leading to civil legal liability.
meanings.sent1: The tort caused harm to the victim.
meanings.sent2: He sued the company for the tort they committed.
meanings.sent3: The funny part of the movie was when they joked about a tort.
meanings.sent4: Her betrayal felt like a tort to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The image of the broken vase was a vivid reminder of the tort.

meanings.definition: To commit a tort against someone is to commit a wrongful act or an infringement of a right leading to civil legal liability.
meanings.sent1: She didn't mean to tort him, it was a mistake.
meanings.sent2: If you tort someone, you may face legal consequences.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to tort each other in their game.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to tort her feelings more than he realized.
meanings.sent5: The decision to betray his friend would tort their friendship forever.
